Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: STCE: Not My Preferred Crypto Play
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Summary The Schwab Crypto Thematic ETF seeks to provide exposure to companies exposed to the cryptocurrency theme. Despite a solid 132% return since inception, STCE has underperformed peers like BITQ and FDIG. STCE's index methodology results in significant weights to some relatively small companies. I am bullish on Bitcoin and view Bitcoin ETFs as a better crypto play than STCE. The Schwab Crypto Thematic ETF ( STCE ) is an ETF which seeks to deliver exposure to companies that are poised to benefit from the development or utilization of cryptocurrencies. STCE was launched in August 2022 and currently has $106 million in net assets. The fund has a total expense ratio of 0.30% and currently holds 42 securities. While I expect crypto-related assets to do well in the near term, STCE is not my preferred way to play the sector. Management Fee Is Reasonable STCE charges a total expense ratio of 0.30% which I view as reasonable compared to other funds which offer exposure to the crypto industry. Comparable funds include the Bitwise Crypto Industry Innovators ETF ( BITQ ) which has an expense ratio of 0.85%, the VanEck Digital Transformation ETF ( DAPP ) which has an expense ratio of 0.51%, and the Fidelity Crypto Industry and Digital Payments ETF ( FDIG ) which has an expense ratio of 0.39%. Additionally, STCE's expense ratio is reasonable compared to the suite of recently launched ETFs which hold cryptocurrencies directly. The largest Bitcoin ETF, the iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF ( IBIT ) charges a fee of 0.25%. The iShares Ethereum Trust ETF ( ETHA ) also carries a fee of 0.25%. Historical Performance Overview As shown by the chart below, STCE has delivered a total return of 132% since inception. While this level of return is solid on a standalone basis, it is less compelling compared to peer funds. In the time since STCE's inception, BITQ has delivered a total return of 159% while FDIG has delivered a total return of 135%. Perhaps the most important thing to note is that all of these funds have significantly underperformed Bitcoin itself, which has delivered a total return of 337% over the same time period. I believe the reason for this is that Bitcoin has received a far greater level of adoption than any other cryptocurrency. There are a few reasons for this including the fact that Bitcoin has a longer history than other cryptocurrencies and has delivered stronger long-term results for early adopters compared to other cryptocurrencies. I expect this trend to continue as Bitcoin is now easier to access, due to the listing of Bitcoin ETFs, relative to other cryptocurrencies. Moreover, it should also be noted that STCE's largest holding, MicroStrategy ( MSTR ), has delivered outsized gains compared to STCE's other holdings (5 largest current holdings shown below.) As a Bitcoin treasury company, MSTR's focus has been on buying Bitcoin. Thus, without the impact of MSTR (which is primarily a price play on Bitcoin itself), STCE's performance relative to Bitcoin would have been even worse. Data by YCharts Data by YCharts Index Methodology STCE seeks to track the Schwab Crypto Thematic Index, which is constructed using a proprietary rules-based methodology. STCE's prospectus outlines the four-step process: 1) Each company in the eligible universe is scored based on its exposure to the Theme, their ‚ÄúThematic Beta‚Äù. Each company‚Äôs Thematic Beta is calculated by applying a proprietary natural language algorithm using keyword terms to review large volumes of publicly available data, including datasets and documents... (2) Each company with a Thematic Beta score greater than zero is then mapped to one or more common equity securities, including ADRs, GDRs and EDRs, listed on exchanges in the Eligible Trading Venues (the Index Universe). If a corresponding security cannot be identified then the company is removed from consideration... (3) Liquidity and investability screens are then applied to each security in the Index Universe. Securities that do not meet the screen criteria are removed from the Index Universe... (4) The remaining securities in the Index Universe that have passed the applicable liquidity and investability screens are ranked by a function of their Thematic Beta and the weight of the security from the previous rebalancing (if applicable). Up to 50 companies are kept in the Index Universe. The securities are then reviewed by the index provider to ensure that they are positively exposed to the Theme based on one or more factors and business metrics applied by the index provider... One key thing to note is that STCE's index methodology differs from traditional market cap weighted index approaches, as a larger company is not necessarily guaranteed to make up a larger part of the fund. For example, STCE's second-largest holding IREN Ltd. (IREN) has a market cap of just $3.3 billion, while STCE's fourth-largest holding Coinbase (COIN) has a market cap of roughly $88 billion. The thematic beta approach is useful to ensure that larger companies which have some crypto exposure, but are mostly driven by exposure to other businesses, have a smaller weight in the index compared to companies that are more directly exposed to the crypto industry. However, the thematic approach also results in less concentrated exposure to the biggest companies with crypto exposure, such as MicroStrategy and Coinbase. Holdings Overview STCE is a fairly concentrated fund as it holds just 42 securities. The fund's top 5 holdings account for 42% of the fund's assets. One thing to note is that, due to the methodology discussed above, the largest market cap companies in the index such as MicroStrategy and Coinbase have exposures which are significantly lower than would be the case if the index was market cap weighted. On the other hand, much smaller companies such as Iren Ltd. and Cipher Mining have much larger exposure than would be the case if the index was market cap weighted. One interesting thing to note is that STCE has some exposure to companies with minimal exposure to the crypto theme. For example, the fund currently holds shares of PayPal (PYPL), Cboe Global Markets (CBOE), WisdomTree, StoneX Group (SNEX), Nvidia (NVDA), CME Group (CME), Intercontinental Exchange (ICE), and BGC Group (BGC). Together, these companies account for nearly 10% of STCE which is nearly as much as the fund's largest holding, MicroStrategy. While the companies mentioned here all have a small degree of exposure to crypto, I would argue that it is not a major driver of value for most of these companies, and thus these stocks are likely to move based on factors unrelated to crypto markets. STCE is primary focused on U.S. domiciled companies (76% of the portfolio) but also has exposure to Canadian domiciled companies (15.7% of the portfolio) and smaller exposures to companies from other countries. Charles Schwab Charles Schwab My Preferred Alternative to STCE My preferred way to gain exposure to the cryptocurrency theme is through Bitcoin ETFs. Specifically, I have owned the iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF since its early days of trading and continue to hold it. I am very bullish near-term on Bitcoin itself, as I believe the conditions are in place such that a melt up is likely. Positive drivers for Bitcoin in the near-term include the recent halving event earlier this year, inflows for recently launched Bitcoin ETFs, increased institutional investor interest, a more friendly regulatory environment under a Trump administration, and the recent emergence of options on Bitcoin ETFs which have potential to drive a squeeze higher. I think the bull case was well covered by Seeking Alpha contributor Stony Chambers Asset Research in a recent piece, IBIT Options And Insatiable Corporate Demand: A Historical Squeeze Is Coming . Given my bullish view on Bitcoin, one might wonder why MicroStrategy is not my preferred alternative to STCE given that fact that it is a levered play on Bitcoin. The reason why I prefer to own Bitcoin ETFs is that MicroStrategy currently trades at a significant premium to its Bitcoin asset value. I expect the company to aggressively issue stock over the next few months to buy Bitcoin. My view is that this could result in relative underperformance of MicroStrategy as the stock moves down to trade closer to its Bitcoin asset value while Bitcoin itself continues to move higher. Conclusion STCE represents one way for investors to get exposure to companies which are exposed to the cryptocurrency industry. The fund charges a reasonable fee and has performed fairly well historically on a standalone basis. However, STCE has underperformed its peer funds since inception and has significantly underperformed Bitcoin itself. While STCE has exposure to companies that are heavily exposure to the cryptocurrency industry, it also has nearly 10% exposure to companies which are primarily driven by other factors. I view this as a negative, as STCE is not a true pure play vehicle. I am currently bullish on Bitcoin but prefer to express this view through Bitcoin ETFs as opposed to owning STCE.

Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Cardano, XRP Lead Losses Among Majors as Market Slide Liquidates $300M Bullish Bets
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Crypto markets started the week in the red as bitcoin (BTC) slumped during the European morning hours after having briefly crossed the $100,000 level.  BTC fell 2% from its six-figure landmark causing a dive across majors. XRP, dogecoin (DOGE) and Solana‚Äôs SOL fell as much as 5.5%, with BNB Chain‚Äôs BNB and ether (ETH) down 2.5%. Cardano‚Äôs ADA fared the worst with a 7% drop, which came on the back of the Cardano Foundation‚Äôs X account getting temporarily compromised on Sunday.  The market slide led to over $300 million in bullish bets liquidated.  The CoinDesk 20 (CD20), a liquid index tracking the largest tokens by market cap, fell 3.6%. Weakness in majors saw midcaps fall as much as 10%, per Coingecko data.  That slide led to $300 million in longs, or bets on higher prices, to be liquidated, with futures tracking smaller altcoins and meme tokens recording higher losses than BTC or ETH futures in an unusual move, data shows.  The largest single liquidation order happened on Binance ‚Äî a DOGE futures trade valued at $5.53 million.  Meanwhile, Singapore-based QCP Capital expects the market to be rangebound until 2025.  ‚ÄúAlthough we‚Äôre still structurally bullish, spot is likely to range here for the remainder of the holiday season,‚Äù QCP said in a Telegram broadcast on Monday. ‚ÄúHistorically, ETH does not usually put in a new all-time high until January of the post-halving year. This sentiment is also reflected in the options market, where ETH risk reversals are skewed toward calls only from January onwards.‚Äù  BTC‚Äôs failure to remain above the $100,000 market is another concerning sign for a continued rally, some say.  ‚ÄúBitcoin is failing to consolidate above $100K, likely suppressing buying in the overall market, ‚Äú FxPro chief market analyst Alex Kuptsikevich said in a Monday email to CoinDesk. ‚ÄúBitcoin is trading just below $99K with minimal overnight movement. Its inability to grow has negatively impacted altcoins.  ‚ÄúWe view Bitcoin's lull as an important position correction that will help the market shake off short-term overbought conditions and move more reliably higher. However, the next upside momentum could take the price to the $120K area, working off the Fibonacci extension,‚Äù Kuptsikevich added.

Î≥∏Î¨∏: The post Ripple VS SEC: Garlinghouse Reveals $150M Loss in SEC Battle, Slams Gensler appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse didn‚Äôt hold back during his recent appearance on CBS‚Äôs 60 Minutes , offering a direct look at the company‚Äôs ongoing battle with the SEC. He revealed that Ripple has spent over $150 million in legal fees fighting the SEC‚Äôs claims that XRP is an unregistered security. Garlinghouse placed much of the blame on SEC Chair Gary Gensler, accusing him of leading a broader ‚Äúwar on crypto.‚Äù Ripple‚Äôs Fight with the SEC In the interview, Garlinghouse was blunt about the SEC‚Äôs position on XRP. He expressed disbelief over the idea that XRP could be classified as a security: ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm reasonably intelligent about something like, ‚ÄòWhat is security?‚Äô Never once had I considered the possibility that XRP is a security.‚Äù The legal battle has taken a significant toll on Ripple, not only financially but also in shaping the crypto industry‚Äôs path toward clearer regulation. Garlinghouse explained that Ripple, along with other companies, has formed Fairshake ‚Äîa super PAC aimed at challenging what they see as an unjust regulatory environment. Responding to Gensler‚Äôs Approach Launched in 2023, Fairshake was created as a response to Gensler‚Äôs tough stance on cryptocurrency. Garlinghouse pointed out, ‚ÄúIf someone else was SEC Chair, I don‚Äôt see this organization being there,‚Äù which shows Gensler‚Äôs dominant role in shaping current policy. He also emphasized that the crypto industry isn‚Äôt asking for special treatment, but rather for clear and fair regulations to operate under, without the ongoing legal battles. Disappointment with ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù Coverage While Garlinghouse‚Äôs appearance on 60 Minutes was a major moment for the crypto community, he expressed frustration with how the show handled the coverage. He criticized the lack of mention about a recent federal judge‚Äôs ruling that XRP is not a security. Instead, the show gave air time to Spencer, a former SEC official, who repeated the claim that XRP could still be considered a security. Garlinghouse called this a missed opportunity. ‚Äúthe misinformation doesn‚Äôt only hurt Ripple but also the whole industry.‚Äù With the Ripple vs. SEC drama heating up, market uncertainty rises‚Äîread our XRP price prediction to uncover potential trends and future moves! Effect on XRP‚Äôs Price XRP has been under serious pressure from the SEC case, both in terms of perception and its price performance. After the interview, XRP dropped to $2.40 , which would reflect a plunge of 5% within 24 hours. Meanwhile, many investors have targeted the $3 price level for XRP. However, Garlinghouse pointed out that this battle was for much more than price. It was to make sure that crypto has its rightful place in the global economy. FAQs What is the Ripple vs SEC legal battle about? Ripple is fighting SEC allegations that XRP is an unregistered security, with over $150 million spent in legal fees. How did the CBS 60 Minutes interview affect XRP‚Äôs price? After the interview, XRP‚Äôs price dropped by 5% to $2.40, impacted by misinformation and ongoing legal pressure.

Î≥∏Î¨∏: Movement, an Ethereum layer-2 network that was built using MoveVM, issued its native token on Monday with a portion of the tokens being airdropped to early users and community members. Yet, as it reaches new highs, the question arises: Can Lightchain AI (LCAI) , the emerging blockchain-AI fusion, take the reins as the next transformative force in the market? This article explores how the two projects stack up and whether Lightchain AI has what it takes to rival Solana‚Äôs dominance. Solana‚Äôs ascent to new highs Solana‚Äôs journey has been nothing short of impressive, thanks to its efficient design and growing ecosystem. Here‚Äôs why it‚Äôs been turning heads: 1. Blazing-fast transactions Solana can handle up to 65,000 transactions per second (TPS) with super low fees. That‚Äôs a game-changer for developers and users who value speed and affordability. Its unique Proof of History (PoH) combined with Proof of Stake (PoS) ensures lightning-fast confirmations, making it perfect for scaling decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms and NFT marketplaces. 2. A thriving ecosystem Solana‚Äôs ecosystem is growing fast, with all kinds of creative use cases. DeFi platforms: Think decentralized exchanges (DEXs) and yield farming protocols that operate smoother than ever. Big backing With investment from major venture capital firms and support from institutions, Solana has built credibility with both crypto enthusiasts and mainstream users. This has also helped boost its price and market cap. The challenges Solana faces Of course, it‚Äôs not all smooth sailing for Solana . There are some roadblocks that could give competitors like Lightchain AI a chance to shine. Network reliability issues Solana has dealt with frequent outages during high-traffic periods, which hasn‚Äôt exactly helped its reputation. Developers and investors need a network they can count on, especially for important DeFi and web3 applications. Decentralization concerns Its validator network is relatively small, which raises questions about how decentralized it really is. For people who prioritize blockchain‚Äôs trustless nature, this can be a drawback. Stiff competition While Solana‚Äôs PoH technology was groundbreaking when it launched, newer projects like Lightchain AI are stepping in with features like Proof of Intelligence (PoI) that could steal the spotlight. Solana‚Äôs achievements are impressive, but it‚Äôll need to tackle these challenges if it wants to stay ahead in the ever-evolving blockchain world. Proof of Intelligence: A game-changing consensus mechanism Lightchain AI‚Äôs PoI takes a fresh approach to consensus. Instead of relying on traditional mining, it rewards nodes for performing AI tasks like model training and optimization. Here‚Äôs why it‚Äôs a big deal: It creates real-world value by advancing AI research and applications. It‚Äôs sustainable and energy-efficient‚Äîno more energy-draining mining. It‚Äôs scalable without compromising network security. 2. Artificial Intelligence Virtual Machine: A smart new layer The AIVM adds a unique layer that‚Äôs specifically designed for executing AI tasks on the blockchain. Developers can: Build dApps powered by real-time AI analytics. Use scalable AI solutions for industries like healthcare, supply chain, and finance. With decentralized governance, token holders have a say in shaping the project‚Äôs future, creating trust and inclusivity across the board. Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Digital Asset Investment Products Hit Record-Breaking $3.85B Weekly Inflows
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Digital asset investment products witnessed record inflows last week, reaching $3.85 billion and surpassing the previous record set just weeks earlier. The surge has propelled year-to-date (YTD) inflows to $41 billion, with total assets under management (AuM) climbing to an all-time high of $165 billion, according to a report from CoinShares . By comparison, the 2021 bull cycle saw inflows of $10.6 billion and an AuM peak of $83 billion. U.S. Leads in Terms of Inflows Regionally, inflows were led by the United States, which accounted for $3.6 billion of the total. Other significant contributions came from Switzerland ($160 million), Germany ($116 million), Canada ($14 million), and Australia ($10 million). Bitcoin investment products dominated the inflows, attracting $2.5 billion and bringing its YTD total to $36.5 billion. Meanwhile, products that allow investors to short Bitcoin saw modest inflows of $6.2 million, a figure lower than historical norms following sharp price rises. This suggests caution among investors against the cryptocurrency‚Äôs recent upward momentum. Ethereum also broke records, registering its highest-ever weekly inflow of $1.2 billion. The surge overshadowed Ethereum‚Äôs July ETF launch and came at the expense of Solana, which experienced $14 million in outflows for the second consecutive week. Digital asset investment products saw the largest weekly inflows on record last week totalling US$3.85bn! This brings total year-to-date (YTD) inflows to US$41bn and total assets under management (AuM) to a new high of US$165bn. #Bitcoin saw inflows of US$2.5bn, Short‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/nDxjZzlHpm ‚Äî CoinShares US (@CoinSharesUS) December 9, 2024 As reported, spot Ether ETFs recorded their largest single-day inflow on December 5. The inflow surge surpassed the previous record of $333 million set on November 29, highlighting growing investor confidence in Ether ETFs. Blockchain equities saw inflows of $124 million, marking the largest weekly increase since January. The surge reflects growing investor optimism fueled by improved profit margins for Bitcoin miners. $10 Billion Flowed into Spot Bitcoin ETFs Since Trump Win In the broader market, nearly $10 billion has flowed into U.S. exchange-traded funds (ETFs) directly investing in Bitcoin since the re-election of President Donald Trump on November 5. The influx has lifted ETF assets to approximately $113 billion, underscoring investor confidence in the administration‚Äôs pro-crypto stance. President Trump has pledged to replace the Biden administration‚Äôs skepticism toward digital assets with supportive regulations, including the concept of a strategic national Bitcoin reserve. His administration‚Äôs appointments of crypto advocates to key regulatory and policy roles, such as the head of the Securities and Exchange Commission, have further fueled market optimism. Bitcoin prices reflect this sentiment, surpassing $100,000 for the first time on December 5. Although the token briefly dipped to $92,000 due to volatility, it remains on a six-week streak of gains, its longest since 2021‚Äôs crypto boom. While Bitcoin‚Äôs historic surge past the $100,000 milestone has captivated the cryptocurrency market, Sergei Gorev, Head of Risk at YouHodler, remains cautious. In a recent statement shared with Cryptonews.com, Gorev predicted that the price may see only moderate growth beyond this level before a significant correction takes hold. ‚ÄúThe cryptocurrency market is very fond of round numbers, and the price often unfolds in such cases.‚Äù The post Digital Asset Investment Products Hit Record-Breaking $3.85B Weekly Inflows appeared first on Cryptonews .

Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Amazon Shareholders Urge Bitcoin Adoption as Treasury Asset to Protect Value
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Amazon shareholders have called on the tech giant to consider Bitcoin as a treasury asset, arguing that this could protect shareholder value while aligning with emerging financial trends. The resolution requests Amazon‚Äôs board to assess the long-term benefits of incorporating Bitcoin into its treasury strategy. Bitcoin‚Äôs Appeal Grows Amazon shareholders, guided by the conservative think tank National Center for Public Policy Research (NCPPR), have proposed an important strategy urging the tech giant to allocate part of its $88 billion in cash reserves to Bitcoin. This proposal is driven by the growing recognition of Bitcoin‚Äôs potential as a hedge against inflation, a concern highlighted by the NCPPR‚Äôs assertion that traditional metrics like the Consumer Price Index (CPI) may understate actual inflation rates, which it estimates closer to 10%. Emphasizing Bitcoin‚Äôs historical performance, the NCPPR argued that despite its volatility, the asset has consistently outpaced traditional financial instruments such as corporate bonds. The proposal pointed out several prominent examples of corporate Bitcoin adoption, like MicroStrategy, which holds over 402,000 BTC valued at $40 billion, and Tesla, further substantiating this claim. Analysts speculate that if Amazon embraces Bitcoin, it could catalyze a broader corporate shift, potentially influencing giants like Apple. Industry voices, including Binance‚Äôs Changpeng Zhao, have amplified this push, advocating Bitcoin payments as the next logical step for Amazon. Microsoft Faces Push for Bitcoin Diversification The proposal comes a little over a month after the think tank announced plans to propose a Bitcoin Diversification Assessment at Microsoft‚Äôs annual shareholder meeting on December 10. The proposal, detailed in a filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), advocated for Microsoft to consider Bitcoin as a hedge against inflation and macroeconomic pressures. It suggests allocating at least 1% of the company‚Äôs total assets to the cryptocurrency. Microsoft‚Äôs board, on the other hand, opposed the idea and requested the shareholders to vote against it. The board argues that Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies have already been assessed in the company‚Äôs financial strategies and continue to be monitored for potential opportunities. Earlier this month, Michael Saylor, co-founder of MicroStrategy, recently urged Microsoft‚Äôs board of directors with a proposal urging the company to adopt Bitcoin on a larger scale. Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Crypto Fear & Greed Index Falls to 78, Remaining in ‚ÄòExtreme Greed‚Äô Zone
Î≥∏Î¨∏: In the dynamic and often volatile world of cryptocurrency, market sentiment plays a crucial role in shaping price movements and investment strategies. One of the most widely referenced tools for gauging this sentiment is the Crypto Fear & Greed Index . As of December 9, 2024, the index has fallen to 78 , maintaining its position in the ‚ÄòExtreme Greed‚Äô zone. This persistent level of extreme greed signals a market that remains highly bullish, albeit with underlying concerns about potential overheating and subsequent corrections. Understanding the Crypto Fear & Greed Index What is the Crypto Fear & Greed Index? The Crypto Fear & Greed Index is a metric designed to evaluate the prevailing sentiment within the cryptocurrency market. Developed by the software development platform Alternative , the index aggregates data from various indicators to provide a comprehensive snapshot of market emotions. Ranging from 0 to 100, the index categorizes sentiment into five distinct zones: Extreme Fear (0-24): Indicates significant pessimism, often preceding market bottoms. Fear (25-49): Reflects apprehension and uncertainty among investors. Neutral (50-74): Suggests a balanced market sentiment. Greed (75-99): Denotes strong optimism and potential market exuberance. Extreme Greed (100): Signifies overwhelming bullishness, often leading to market tops. The Current Reading: 78 in the Extreme Greed Zone With the index currently at 78 , the market remains firmly in the ‚ÄòExtreme Greed‚Äô zone. This level indicates that the majority of the top 100 cryptocurrencies, as tracked by CoinMarketCap (CMC), have been outperforming Bitcoin (BTC) over the past 90 days. While a high index value reflects robust investor confidence and a bullish market outlook, it also raises concerns about potential market overheating and the sustainability of current price levels. Components of the Crypto Fear & Greed Index The index is calculated based on six different factors, each contributing to the overall sentiment score: Volatility (25%) Market Momentum/Volume (25%) Social Media (15%) Surveys (15%) Bitcoin Dominance (10%) Google Trends (10%) 1. Volatility (25%) Volatility measures the degree of variation in Bitcoin‚Äôs price over a specific period. High volatility often correlates with fear, as significant price swings can signal instability and risk. Conversely, lower volatility tends to reflect a more stable and confident market sentiment. In the current context, a relatively stable volatility level contributes to maintaining a high index score, as extreme price fluctuations are less pronounced. 2. Market Momentum/Volume (25%) Market Momentum and Volume assess the trading activity and the speed at which prices are changing. High trading volumes paired with upward price momentum typically indicate strong buying interest, pushing the index higher. The current high momentum suggests that investors are actively purchasing cryptocurrencies, further fueling the extreme greed sentiment. 3. Social Media (15%) Social Media sentiment analyzes the tone and volume of discussions surrounding cryptocurrencies across platforms like Twitter, Reddit, and Facebook. Positive sentiments and increased mentions can drive enthusiasm and fear of missing out (FOMO), contributing to higher index scores. Currently, social media sentiment remains overwhelmingly positive, reinforcing the extreme greed zone. 4. Surveys (15%) Surveys gather direct feedback from investors regarding their sentiment and outlook on the market. When a majority of respondents express bullish sentiments and confidence in future price increases, the index reflects this optimism. Presently, survey results indicate strong positive sentiment, supporting the high index value. 5. Bitcoin Dominance (10%) Bitcoin Dominance measures Bitcoin‚Äôs market capitalization relative to the total cryptocurrency market cap. A decreasing Bitcoin dominance often signifies a rising interest in altcoins, contributing to higher greed levels as investors seek higher returns in alternative assets. The current dominance trends suggest a balanced yet slightly favoring Bitcoin‚Äôs stable role in the market. 6. Google Trends (10%) Google Trends analyze the search interest in cryptocurrencies over time. Increased search volumes for terms like ‚ÄúBitcoin,‚Äù ‚ÄúEthereum,‚Äù or ‚Äúcrypto investment‚Äù indicate growing public interest and can drive market excitement. The index benefits from high search activity, reflecting heightened curiosity and engagement with the crypto market. Implications of Remaining in the Extreme Greed Zone Market Sentiment and Investor Behavior The ‚ÄòExtreme Greed‚Äô classification indicates that investors are highly optimistic, often leading to increased buying activity and upward price momentum. This bullish sentiment can drive prices to new highs as more participants enter the market, fueled by the fear of missing out (FOMO) on potential gains. However, sustained extreme greed can also signal overvaluation. When sentiment becomes excessively bullish, it can lead to speculative bubbles, where prices rise beyond their intrinsic value. This environment increases the risk of a significant correction or crash, as market participants may eventually lose confidence, triggering a sell-off. Potential for Market Corrections Historically, periods of extreme greed have often been followed by market corrections. For instance, the 2017 Bitcoin bull run saw the index reach extreme levels, only to be followed by a sharp decline in 2018. While past performance is not indicative of future results, the current high index value suggests that investors should be cautious and prepared for possible downturns. Impact on Altcoins and Bitcoin A high Crypto Fear & Greed Index not only affects Bitcoin but also has broader implications for the entire cryptocurrency market. Altcoins, which often exhibit higher volatility than Bitcoin, can experience more significant price swings. During periods of extreme greed, altcoins may see disproportionate gains as investors seek higher returns, potentially inflating their valuations beyond sustainable levels. Conversely, if the market sentiment shifts and extreme greed subsides, altcoins may be among the first to experience corrections. Investors might revert to more stable assets, including Bitcoin, reducing the relative dominance of altcoins and leading to a market-wide adjustment. Historical Context: Extreme Greed and Market Cycles Past Instances of Extreme Greed The Crypto Fear & Greed Index has recorded extreme greed several times in the past, each corresponding with major bull runs and subsequent corrections: December 2017: The index reached extreme greed levels as Bitcoin‚Äôs price surged to nearly $20,000. This period was marked by massive media coverage, widespread retail investor participation, and speculative trading, culminating in a significant market correction in 2018. May 2021: Following Bitcoin‚Äôs peak of around $64,000, the index again entered the extreme greed zone. This period saw heightened institutional investment and mainstream adoption but was followed by a notable downturn due to regulatory concerns and market saturation. November 2023: The index hit extreme greed amid a booming crypto market driven by technological advancements and increased integration with traditional financial systems. While the market remained bullish for a while, the index eventually stabilized as investors began to reassess valuations. Lessons from the Past Analyzing historical instances of extreme greed offers valuable insights: Sustainability: Markets cannot sustain extreme greed indefinitely. Periods of excessive optimism are often followed by corrections as investor sentiment shifts. Investor Preparedness: Understanding market cycles helps investors prepare for volatility. Diversification and risk management become crucial during high sentiment phases. Regulatory Influence: Regulatory actions can significantly impact market sentiment. Clear and supportive regulations can sustain growth, while stringent measures can trigger corrections. Expert Opinions: Navigating Extreme Greed Analyst Perspectives Financial analysts and cryptocurrency experts offer diverse views on the implications of an extreme greed index: Optimistic Views: Some analysts argue that extreme greed reflects strong market fundamentals and increased adoption. They believe that high sentiment can drive continued growth and innovation within the crypto ecosystem. Cautious Optimism: Others adopt a more balanced stance, recognizing the current bullish sentiment but emphasizing the need for caution. They suggest that while the market may continue to rise, investors should be mindful of the potential for corrections and avoid overexposure. Bearish Predictions: A faction of skeptics warns that extreme greed is a red flag for impending market downturns. They advocate for profit-taking, diversification, and maintaining a long-term investment perspective to mitigate risks. Investment Strategies During Extreme Greed Given the high Crypto Fear & Greed Index, investors might consider the following strategies: Profit-Taking: Locking in gains by selling portions of profitable holdings can protect against potential downturns. Diversification: Spreading investments across various assets, including stablecoins, stocks, and traditional financial instruments, reduces risk exposure. Risk Management: Implementing stop-loss orders and position sizing can help manage potential losses during volatile periods. Long-Term Holding: Adopting a buy-and-hold strategy can help investors weather short-term volatility, focusing on the long-term potential of their investments. The Broader Market Context: Current Trends and Developments Technological Innovations Advancements in blockchain technology continue to drive interest and investment in the crypto market. Innovations such as layer-two scaling solutions , decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms , and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) contribute to the expanding utility and adoption of cryptocurrencies. These developments enhance the functionality and appeal of digital assets, supporting the high sentiment reflected in the Crypto Fear & Greed Index. Regulatory Landscape The regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies remains a critical factor influencing market sentiment. Positive regulatory developments, such as the approval of Bitcoin ETFs and supportive policies in major economies, can bolster investor confidence and sustain bullish trends. Conversely, regulatory crackdowns and unfavorable policies can dampen sentiment and trigger sell-offs. Institutional Adoption Institutional interest in cryptocurrencies has grown significantly, with major financial institutions, hedge funds, and publicly traded companies incorporating digital assets into their portfolios. This institutional adoption adds legitimacy to the market, driving increased investment and supporting high sentiment levels. The involvement of institutional players can also enhance liquidity and market stability, mitigating some of the risks associated with extreme greed. Macroeconomic Factors Global economic conditions, including inflation rates, interest rate policies, and geopolitical tensions, continue to impact the cryptocurrency market. High inflation rates, for instance, can drive investors towards cryptocurrencies as a hedge against fiat currency devaluation. Similarly, economic uncertainties and political instability can increase demand for decentralized assets, reinforcing bullish sentiment. Potential Risks and Considerations Market Volatility While a high Crypto Fear & Greed Index reflects strong investor confidence, it also underscores the inherent volatility of the cryptocurrency market. Significant price fluctuations can result in substantial gains but also expose investors to considerable losses. Managing this volatility through strategic investment approaches is essential to safeguard portfolios. Regulatory Uncertainty The evolving regulatory landscape poses ongoing challenges for the cryptocurrency market. Changes in regulations can impact the legality, trading mechanisms, and overall acceptance of cryptocurrencies, influencing market sentiment and investor behavior. Staying informed about regulatory developments and adapting investment strategies accordingly is crucial for navigating this uncertainty. Overvaluation Concerns Extreme greed can lead to overvaluation, where asset prices exceed their intrinsic value. This overvaluation increases the risk of a market correction, as investors may reassess valuations and shift towards more stable assets. Monitoring valuation metrics and maintaining a disciplined investment approach can help mitigate the risks associated with overvaluation. Psychological Factors Investor psychology plays a significant role in market dynamics. During periods of extreme greed, emotions like FOMO and euphoria can drive irrational investment decisions, leading to herd behavior and speculative bubbles. Maintaining emotional discipline and adhering to a well-defined investment strategy can help investors avoid the pitfalls of emotionally driven decisions. Future Outlook: Navigating the Crypto Market Sustaining Growth Amid Extreme Greed While the current extreme greed sentiment suggests robust market growth, sustaining this momentum requires continuous innovation, regulatory support, and the maturation of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. Projects that offer tangible use cases, demonstrate technological advancements, and foster strong community engagement are more likely to sustain growth and attract long-term investment. Preparing for Potential Corrections Investors should remain vigilant and prepared for potential market corrections. Implementing risk management strategies, diversifying portfolios, and maintaining a balanced investment approach can help mitigate the impact of sudden downturns. Recognizing the cyclical nature of market sentiment and positioning portfolios to capitalize on both bullish and bearish phases is essential for long-term success. The Role of Emerging Technologies Emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence (AI), the Internet of Things (IoT), and decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), are likely to shape the future of the cryptocurrency market. These technologies can enhance the functionality, security, and interoperability of digital assets, driving further adoption and investment. Keeping abreast of technological trends and integrating relevant innovations can provide a competitive edge in the evolving market landscape. Institutional Influence and Market Maturity As institutional involvement in the cryptocurrency market deepens, the market is likely to mature, exhibiting increased stability and reduced volatility. Institutional players bring disciplined investment approaches, risk management practices, and significant capital inflows, contributing to a more robust and resilient market infrastructure. This maturation can support sustained growth and mitigate some of the risks associated with extreme greed. Conclusion The Crypto Fear & Greed Index serves as a valuable barometer for understanding market sentiment and guiding investment strategies within the cryptocurrency ecosystem. As of December 9, 2024, the index‚Äôs value of 78 underscores a market entrenched in ‚ÄòExtreme Greed‚Äô , reflecting strong investor confidence and bullish sentiment. While this high sentiment can drive continued market growth and innovation, it also heightens the risk of overvaluation and potential market corrections. Investors navigating this environment should adopt a strategic approach, emphasizing diversification, risk management, and emotional discipline to capitalize on the opportunities presented by extreme greed while safeguarding against its inherent risks. Staying informed about technological advancements, regulatory developments, and macroeconomic factors will further enhance the ability to make informed and resilient investment decisions. As the cryptocurrency market continues to evolve, the interplay between investor sentiment, technological innovation, and regulatory frameworks will shape its trajectory. By leveraging tools like the Crypto Fear & Greed Index and maintaining a balanced and informed investment strategy, participants can effectively navigate the complexities of the market, harnessing its potential for growth while mitigating the challenges posed by volatility and sentiment-driven dynamics. To stay updated on the latest developments and gain deeper insights into the cryptocurrency landscape, continue exploring our comprehensive coverage and expert analyses. The ever-changing nature of the crypto market demands continuous learning and strategic adaptation, ensuring that investors are well-equipped to thrive in this exciting and transformative financial frontier. To learn more about the innovative startups shaping the future of the crypto industry, explore our article on latest news, where we delve into the most promising ventures and their potential to disrupt traditional industries.

Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Brooklyn DA Shuts Down 40 NFT Websites After 85-Year-Old Artist Loses $135K
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Brooklyn‚Äôs District Attorney‚Äôs Office has dismantled 40 fraudulent NFT marketplace websites following a scheme that defrauded an 85-year-old artist of $135,000. The victim was targeted by a scammer posing as an art dealer on LinkedIn, the DA‚Äôs office revealed on December 6 . The scammer persuaded the artist to mint his work on a counterfeit NFT marketplace designed to mimic the reputable OpenSea platform. Scammer Demands $135,000 Fee After falsely claiming that the artist had earned $300,000 in profits, the scammer demanded a $135,000 ‚Äúfee‚Äù to release the funds. To meet the demand, the artist liquidated his retirement savings, used credit cards, and took out a loan. He later realized the promised payment was a fabrication, leaving him financially devastated. ‚ÄúCryptocurrency scams can take many forms but have similar characteristics, such as preying on vulnerable victims and requesting fees to redeem purported earnings,‚Äù said District Attorney Eric Gonzalez. ‚ÄúThese were the tactics used in this case, leading our investigators to a network of fraudulent websites that specifically scammed artists. It is my hope that by shutting these domains and raising awareness about this scheme, we will prevent others from falling victim to this scam.‚Äù Investigators traced the stolen funds to accounts at a Nigerian exchange, where they were primarily converted to local currency, making recovery nearly impossible. Brooklyn District Attorney Shuts Down 40 Domains Associated With NFT Crypto Scam Targeting Artists ‚Äú[B]y shutting these domains and raising awareness about this scheme, we will prevent others from falling victim to this scam.‚Äù Read more https://t.co/MNZJW0qnFx pic.twitter.com/UGx8kFsIdO ‚Äî Brooklyn District Attorney Eric Gonzalez (@BrooklynDA) December 6, 2024 The fake marketplace websites also originated from Nigeria, the DA‚Äôs office reported. Some of these sites employed phishing tactics, urging users to input their crypto wallet seed phrases, granting scammers full access to victims‚Äô digital wallets. Two additional artists, based in Georgia and California, were also tricked by the same fraudulent operation. The DA‚Äôs Virtual Currency Unit has warned artists to remain vigilant and conduct thorough research before engaging with NFT platforms. ‚ÄúIf it seems too good to be true, it likely is,‚Äù it said. ‚ÄúDo your own research and seek opinions from fellow artists.‚Äù Similar cases include a sophisticated hacking operation that allegedly stole $11 million in crypto and sensitive data from individuals and companies across multiple countries. According to court filings, the alleged hackers targeted at least 29 individuals, with one victim losing over $6.3 million in cryptocurrency after their email and digital wallets were compromised. The post Brooklyn DA Shuts Down 40 NFT Websites After 85-Year-Old Artist Loses $135K appeared first on Cryptonews .

Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Made in the USA: 6 American Blockchains Driving Innovation in a Pro-Crypto Climate
Î≥∏Î¨∏: As the US enters a new era of pro-crypto leadership under the Trump administration, its domestic blockchain industry is poised for a period of dramatic growth. With key figures like Robert Kennedy Jr., Howard Lutnick, and Tulsi Gabbard set to influence policy and a light-touch SEC green-lighting compliant crypto enterprises, the environment for blockchain businesses is becoming increasingly favorable. This renewed support for digital assets and blockchain technology realigns America with longstanding tradition of technological innovation. While these tailwinds don‚Äôt alter the technical footprint of existing US-based blockchains, they certainly make it easier for them to do business: onboarding institutions; integrating web3 protocols; partnering with companies intent on leveraging their stack. The following blockchains have already done the hard work of building out their respective ecosystems. Now that the US is open for crypto business, they‚Äôre poised to flourish. Constellation Network: Data Security Meets Decentralization Constellation Network stands out for its focus on data assurance and interoperability. Founded in 2017, it‚Äôs developed Hypergraph Transfer Protocol (HGTP), a framework that reimagines how blockchains securely process and validate data. Designed to address big data challenges, HGTP facilitates seamless communication between blockchains, making it as integral to web3 as HTTP is to the world wide web. What sets Constellation apart is its adoption by mission-critical industries. Its zero-trust architecture and edge validation capabilities make it a natural fit for military and supply chain applications. Validated by the U.S. Department of Defense and the Air Force Research Laboratory , Constellation‚Äôs solutions are already embedded in cutting-edge environments like Panasonic Toughbooks, ensuring real-time insights and secure workflows in ruggedized operations. Moreover, its partnership with Common Crawl to integrate blockchain and AI highlights its vision for the future of decentralized data. As Constellation opens its metagraph application layer to developers, it‚Äôs positioning itself as a hub for real innovation. The ability to integrate seamlessly with existing hardware and workflows makes it a frontrunner in applications requiring scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions. Hashgraph: Blockchain with Enterprise-Grade Efficiency Hedera Hashgraph has carved a niche as a highly efficient enterprise-ready blockchain. Its unique hashgraph consensus algorithm provides high throughput and security without compromising on energy efficiency. Hedera‚Äôs governing council, which includes corporate heavyweights like Google, IBM, and Boeing, ensures its decentralized infrastructure remains resilient and enterprise-focused. HBAR‚Äôs utility extends beyond its governance model. Its energy-efficient approach to achieving consensus is increasingly relevant as environmental concerns take center stage in blockchain discussions. Hedera has also embraced tokenization and decentralized identity solutions, making it a key player in sectors like supply chain management, healthcare, and IoT. The network‚Äôs ability to handle up to 10,000 transactions per second gives it an edge in scalability. As more organizations seek blockchain solutions that can integrate with existing systems without overhauling infrastructure, Hedera Hashgraph is a strong contender. Ripple: Bridging Global Payments Through Blockchain Ripple has long been synonymous with blockchain-based cross-border payments. Its native token, XRP , facilitates near-instant settlement at minimal cost, solving inefficiencies in traditional banking systems. Ripple‚Äôs partnerships with major financial institutions have solidified its reputation as a blockchain tailored for real-world financial use cases. Despite regulatory hurdles in recent years, Ripple has emerged stronger, with the resolution of its SEC lawsuit positioning it for renewed growth. Its RippleNet technology continues to gain traction globally, offering liquidity and settlement solutions that reduce the friction of international transactions. Ripple‚Äôs focus on interoperability is also noteworthy. By integrating with Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) initiatives, Ripple aims to modernize global payments while maintaining compliance with evolving financial regulations. Algorand: Balancing Performance and Sustainability Algorand is a blockchain designed for high performance, offering near-instant finality and low transaction costs. Its Pure Proof-of-Stake (PPoS) consensus mechanism ensures security while minimizing energy usage, making it one of the greenest blockchains on the market. With an ecosystem rich in decentralized finance projects and NFTs, Algorand has attracted retail users attracted by its speed and ease of use. Its recent focus on institutional adoption, meanwhile, has positioned Algorand as a go-to blockchain for enterprises exploring tokenized assets and blockchain-based governance. Algorand‚Äôs support for seamless smart contract deployment and its collaboration with global organizations like the International Blockchain Monetary Reserve (IBMR) highlight its role as a versatile, sustainable blockchain platform. Cardano: Advancing Blockchain with a Research-First Approach Cardano has earned its reputation as a research-driven blockchain. Famously founded by Charles Hoskinson, one of Ethereum‚Äôs co-creators, Cardano employs a layered architecture that separates computation from settlement, enhancing security and scalability. The platform‚Äôs Ouroboros consensus algorithm, rooted in academic rigor, makes it one of the most secure proof-of-stake blockchains available. Cardano‚Äôs focus on decentralized governance is exemplified by its Project Catalyst initiative, which funds community-driven projects to foster ecosystem growth. Cardano is also a strong advocate for blockchain adoption in underserved regions, particularly in Africa, where it‚Äôs partnering with governments and institutions to build blockchain-based solutions for identity and financial inclusion. Stellar: Democratizing Global Financial Access Stellar is a blockchain designed to facilitate low-cost, cross-border transactions. With a focus on financial inclusion, Stellar connects traditional financial institutions with blockchain-based solutions, enabling seamless value transfer across borders. Its partnership with IBM on the World Wire payment network demonstrates its ability to integrate with legacy systems while introducing the benefits of blockchain technology. Stellar‚Äôs Stellar Development Foundation (SDF) actively promotes ecosystem growth, funding initiatives to expand its use cases. With a transaction cost of fractions of a cent and near-instant processing times, Stellar is particularly suited for remittances and microtransactions. Its commitment to financial inclusion makes it a standout in regions where traditional banking systems are inaccessible. A Bright Future for US Blockchain Projects As the US enters a more crypto-friendly era, these American-made blockchains are well-positioned to lead the global market. From Constellation‚Äôs data-focused solutions to Stellar‚Äôs mission of financial inclusion, each network offers unique advantages that reflect the diversity and potential of the nation‚Äôs thriving blockchain industry. With pro-crypto leadership in Washington and the emergence of policies that encourage innovation, the stage is set for these US-centered blockchains to thrive. As blockchain technology continues to redefine finance, governance, and data security, these projects underscore America‚Äôs role as a driving force in delivering global blockchain solutions. Î≥∏Î¨∏: Bitcoin maxi and El Salvador's Bitcoin Advisor Max Keiser has raised his target for BTC by tenfold following MicroStrategy co-founder Michael Saylor‚Äôs gold rug pull strategy. The advisor to Nayib Bukele, El Salvador‚Äôs pro-Bitcoin president, raised his Bitcoin price prediction from $200,000 to $2.2 million in a Sunday tweet , citing Saylor‚Äôs grand gold rug pull masterclass.Saylor Proposes Strategy to Defend BRICS AttackIn an interview with Yahoo Finance, Saylor inferred that the United States could use Bitcoin to stop BRICS‚Äôs dollar harassment. He argued that the move would steer a global Bitcoin buying spree, boosting the asset‚Äôs value and, consequently, the US economy.Furthermore, Saylor also teased a ‚Äúgreat twist‚Äù on the strategy, which involves the US selling all its gold reserves to stack Bitcoin. He stated that the potential $20 billion market cap diversion from gold to Bitcoin has a ‚Äúvery high probability of success.‚ÄùKeiser implied that Saylor just revealed MicroStrategy‚Äôs incessant fixed-income market exploration endgame. He stated that the software firm has been raising funds from the $200 trillion sector to rug-pull gold, speculating that it would come to fruition.On this basis, Keiser raised his Bitcoin projection tenfold from $220,000 to $2.2 million. Notably, the price call still falls below Saylor‚Äôs $13 million Bitcoin prediction.Meanwhile, a surge to $2.2 million from the current market price of $98,680 would entail a 2,129% upsurge. Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Bitcoin ($BTC) just under $100,000 as Microsoft and Amazon shareholders consider buying in
Î≥∏Î¨∏: While Bitcoin ($BTC) has been consolidating around $100,000 for nearly three weeks, Microsoft and Amazon shareholders are considering whether to add Bitcoin to their respective balance sheets. Microsoft shareholders vote on Tuesday Tuesday marks the day when Microsoft shareholders will vote on the proposal to add Bitcoin to the balance sheet of the tech giant. Given Bitcoin‚Äôs upward price momentum over the last couple of years, and with the likes of Blackrock and other trusted funds buying Bitcoin hand over fist for the last eleven months, it might be guessed that Microsoft shareholders would also be keen to dip their toes into this new world of sound digital money. However, for such a tech leviathan as Microsoft to move any of its treasury into Bitcoin would be a very large step indeed. Especially considering that the Microsoft board of directors has specifically counselled shareholders to vote ‚Äúno‚Äù to the proposition. That said, Michael Saylor, Chairman of MicroStrategy, which holds the largest amount of Bitcoin of any company treasury, managed to convince the Microsoft board to show a short 3-minute video of the advantages of adding Bitcoin to its treasury, during their shareholder meeting on Tuesday. Saylor said that three minutes was probably not enough for such an important consideration, so he decided to release the video he made across social media, so that shareholders would be able to see it and digest it properly before the vote. Amazon shareholders say board has a fiduciary responsibility Meanwhile, the board of commerce giant Amazon is also being asked to diversify its treasury by adding Bitcoin. A shareholder proposal urges the Amazon board to build at least a 5% treasury holding in Bitcoin. The proposal goes as far as to say that even though Bitcoin is volatile, the board has a fiduciary responsibility to add it to the balance sheet, given the likelihood that it will appreciate over time a lot more than bonds, or other such traditional assets. $BTC correctional phase continues Source: TradingView The $BTC price is still in a correctional phase. The short-term time frame shows that the price has just dipped under the 0.382 Fibonacci and that it may be coming down to stronger support at the 0.5 Fibonacci, and could also make a retest of the top of the triangle. The 0.618 Fibonacci is also at a strong horizontal level, and this would have the extra support of the bottom trendline of the triangle. $96,000 could be the bounce level Source: TradingView Looking at a very simple $BTC chart on the daily, it can be seen that there are three main horizontal support lines for the price action over the last month or so. The bears are currently battling with the first line, and if this breaks, the price can head down to the second, thicker line. This is in bold because it corresponds with the 0.618 fibonacci. If one takes into account the ascending trendline - where this bisects the middle support line would be a great place for the bulls to hold the line. A bounce here could then potentially confirm a continuation of the upward trend. If the correction continues below, the last line in the sand would be the bottom of the three horizontal support lines. Just below this a lower low could be made, and a much deeper correction might ensue. Disclaimer: This article is provided for informational purposes only. Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Coinbase Faces Backlash Over Restricted Accounts and Support Delays
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Coinbase has made headlines with two significant developments: the celebration of its 100th perpetual futures contract listing on Coinbase International and growing concerns over account security and support on its main platform. While the international exchange expands its offerings with new listings, including Algorand and Moo Deng, reports of fraudulent activity and account restrictions have raised questions about Coinbase's customer experience and security measures. Coinbase Responds to Surge in Account Restrictions and Fraudulent Activities: Users Voice Concerns Over Support and Security Over the weekend, Coinbase found itself under scrutiny as several users reported sudden account restrictions on the platform. Complaints flooded social media, particularly X, where frustrated customers sought clarity. In response, Coinbase's @CoinbaseSupport account addressed the issue in a series of posts, urging users to exercise patience and caution. ‚ÄùPlease bear with us and don‚Äôt believe everything you see on Twitter,‚Äù the account emphasized. The recent surge in complaints coincides with reports of an uptick in phishing attacks and fraudulent schemes targeting Coinbase users. On Saturday night, pseudonymous security researcher and SEAL 911 team member @pcaversaccio shared alarming details about a wave of account compromises. ‚ÄùYesterday skiddies (again) decided to fake Coinbase support and drained multiple accounts,‚Äù he posted on X. The term ‚Äùskiddies,‚Äù short for ‚Äùscript kiddies,‚Äù refers to inexperienced hackers who rely on prewritten scripts to execute cyber exploits rather than creating their own tools. These opportunistic attackers have increasingly targeted digital asset platforms, leveraging deceptive methods to trick unsuspecting users into revealing sensitive information. In its thread on X, Coinbase acknowledged the heightened activity, attributing it partly to a significant influx of new and returning users post-election. ‚ÄùAlong with this surge, as is typical with surges, we‚Äôve seen a 2-3x increase in fraudulent attempts,‚Äù the @CoinbaseSupport account wrote. Despite these challenges, Coinbase highlighted the effectiveness of its fraud-prevention systems, claiming they had saved customers ‚Äùtens of millions in losses in November alone.‚Äù However, Coinbase‚Äôs efforts to combat fraudulent activities have not been without criticism. Users and security experts have voiced concerns over the exchange‚Äôs reliance on stringent account security measures, which some argue are overly sensitive and prone to false positives. The VPN Debate: Balancing Security and Usability Coinbase‚Äôs stance on VPN use has sparked particular controversy. In a Dec. 2 post, Scott Shapiro, Coinbase‚Äôs product director, explained that attackers frequently use VPNs, making them a potential red flag in the platform‚Äôs risk models. However, Shapiro clarified that VPN usage alone would not trigger account restrictions. Instead, it is flagged when combined with other risk factors, such as logins from unknown devices in unfamiliar locations attempting to transfer large sums of cryptocurrency. Critics, including rival exchange Kraken‚Äôs chief security officer Nick Percoco, have pushed back against Coinbase‚Äôs approach. ‚ÄùA VPN is your digital armor,‚Äù @pcaversaccio wrote, emphasizing its necessity for users who rely on public Wi-Fi or seek to protect their privacy. Percoco went further, suggesting Coinbase‚Äôs measures could force users to choose between financial freedom and personal safety. Another point of contention has been Coinbase‚Äôs customer support. Users have reported delays in receiving assistance, exacerbating frustration over account restrictions and fraudulent activity. Taylor Monahan, principal security researcher at Metamask, critiqued Coinbase‚Äôs lack of weekend support, sarcastically remarking, ‚ÄùCrypto operates 9-5 PT Monday-Friday, and no one victimizes your users outside those hours either.‚Äù Coinbase acknowledged the challenges, admitting to a ‚Äùminor increase in restricted accounts and elevated CX wait times‚Äù due to the spike in fraud attempts. ‚ÄùIf you are restricted, we‚Äôre not ignoring you; we‚Äôre working hard to respond asap,‚Äù @CoinbaseSupport assured users. While Coinbase maintains its systems are acting as expected, the platform's handling of the situation has drawn mixed reactions. Some users have praised its proactive fraud prevention, while others have expressed dissatisfaction with the lack of timely communication and perceived overreach in account restrictions. The exchange‚Äôs challenges place the spotlight on the delicate balance between maintaining robust security measures and providing a seamless user experience. With the cryptocurrency market operating 24/7, platforms like Coinbase face mounting pressure to meet user expectations without compromising on safety. Coinbase International Celebrates Milestone with 100th Perpetual Futures Contract Listing In related news, Coinbase International has reached a significant milestone with the listing of its 100th perpetual futures contract. In a celebratory tweet, Coinbase International stated, ‚ÄùWe‚Äôve officially listed our 100th perpetual future on Coinbase International Exchange. That‚Äôs 100 unique opportunities for you to diversify, trade, and grow.‚Äù This milestone is indicative of Coinbase's dedication to innovation in the derivatives space and its ongoing efforts to cater to a growing international user base seeking advanced trading options. However, Coinbase International is not stopping at 100. The exchange has announced the addition of four new perpetual futures contracts, which will be available starting Dec. 12. The new listings include: Moo Deng (MOODENG) Algorand (ALGO) The Sandbox (SAND) Mog Coin (1000MOG) These listings will be accessible to traders on both Coinbase International Exchange and Coinbase Advanced, further broadening the range of assets available for trading. Moo Deng is a Solana-based meme coin inspired by a famous Thai zoo hippo of the same name. Known for its quirky branding and community-driven appeal, Moo Deng has garnered significant attention in the meme coin ecosystem. At the time of writing, Moo Deng's price had dropped by 15.64% in the last 24 hours, reaching $0.4521. Algorand stands out as a blockchain platform emphasizing energy efficiency and security. Its single-layer architecture is designed for instant transaction finality, high throughput, and low fees. ALGO, the native cryptocurrency of the Algorand blockchain, was trading at $0.482, down 3.24% in the last 24 hours. The Sandbox is a virtual metaverse platform where users can create, own, and monetize gaming experiences using non-fungible tokens (NFTs). The SAND token serves as the ecosystem‚Äôs primary utility token. Over the past 24 hours, SAND suffered a drop of 5.02%, trading at $0.8751. Mog Coin, an Ethereum-based meme coin, has captured headlines with its meteoric rise. Recently, it reached an all-time high of $0.000004, but has since settled at $0.000003761. Coinbase International‚Äôs Growing Influence The listing of the 100th perpetual futures contract marks a pivotal moment for Coinbase International as it strengthens its foothold in the global derivatives market. With an increasing number of traders turning to derivatives as a means of hedging and leveraging their positions, Coinbase‚Äôs proactive approach to expanding its offerings is likely to bolster its appeal among retail and institutional investors alike. As the global crypto landscape evolves, Coinbase International's continued focus on expanding its offerings and improving user experience positions it as a key player in the competitive cryptocurrency derivatives market.
