Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Amazon Shareholders Push for Bitcoin Investment: Will It Happen?
Î≥∏Î¨∏: The post Amazon Shareholders Push for Bitcoin Investment: Will It Happen? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News What if Amazon started investing in Bitcoin? That‚Äôs the big idea Amazon shareholders are pitching right now. They want the company to put 5% of its assets into the cryptocurrency. Why? They see it as a way to protect against inflation and, honestly, just make better use of Amazon‚Äôs massive reserves. But, is this as smart as they think? Or is it one of those ideas that sounds good until it‚Äôs not? Let‚Äôs figure it out. Why Bitcoin? Let‚Äôs Look at the Numbers Okay, here‚Äôs the thing. Bitcoin‚Äôs been on a wild ride lately. It grew by 131% in 2024 alone. Over the last five years, it‚Äôs jumped more than 1,200%. That‚Äôs a lot, right? Now compare that to corporate bonds or cash‚Äîwhat Amazon usually keeps in reserve. Those are safe, sure, but they don‚Äôt grow like this. That‚Äôs why the National Center for Public Policy Research (NCPPR), the group behind the proposal , is pushing hard. They‚Äôre basically saying, ‚ÄúHey, Amazon, don‚Äôt sit on this. Even a 5% Bitcoin allocation could be huge for long-term value.‚Äù The National Center for Public Policy Research has submitted the attached shareholder proposal to https://t.co/Lve7Kg1nVI , Inc. for consideration at the 2025 annual shareholder meeting. Shareholders request that the Board assess adding #Bitcoin to the Company‚Äôs Treasury pic.twitter.com/lsgHC0aGrt ‚Äî Tim Kotzman (@TimKotzman) December 8, 2024 And they‚Äôre not wrong. Companies like Tesla and MicroStrategy have already gone for it, and they‚Äôve seen some solid gains. Even Microsoft shareholders will vote on a similar idea soon. It‚Äôs becoming a trend. But not everyone‚Äôs convinced‚Äîyet. As institutions increasingly adopt Bitcoin, its market potential continues to grow‚Äîread our Bitcoin price prediction for expert insights on what‚Äôs next! What If Amazon Goes for It? If Amazon says yes, it won‚Äôt be instant. First, the board has to agree to let shareholders vote on the proposal in April 2025. And even then, they‚Äôd probably start small. Nobody‚Äôs talking about going all-in on Bitcoin here. Source: NCPPR Still, this could shake things up. Some people, like Binance‚Äôs former CEO Changpeng Zhao, are even speculating that Amazon might take it a step further‚Äîlike accepting Bitcoin payments. That sounds futuristic, right? Imagine buying your next Kindle or headphones with Bitcoin. But, honestly, there‚Äôs no guarantee Amazon will go for it. Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Amazon Faces Shareholder Call to Add Bitcoin to Balance Sheet
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Amazon shareholders are calling on the company to invest at least 5% of its assets in Bitcoin through a proposal from the National Center for Public Policy Research (NCPPR). Podcaster Tim Kotzman shared the proposal on X , which pointed out Bitcoin‚Äôs superior performance over corporate bonds and referencing similar investments by companies like MicroStrategy and Tesla. The think tank‚Äôs letter criticizes the Consumer Price Index (CPI), which shows a 4.95% inflation rate, as an unreliable measure of currency debasement. It argues the true inflation rate could be twice as high. Further, the letter warned that this undermines Amazon‚Äôs $88b in cash and short-term assets. To protect shareholder value, it recommended using Bitcoin as a hedge against inflation. The National Center for Public Policy Research has submitted the attached shareholder proposal to https://t.co/Lve7Kg1nVI , Inc. for consideration at the 2025 annual shareholder meeting. Shareholders request that the Board assess adding #Bitcoin to the Company‚Äôs Treasury pic.twitter.com/lsgHC0aGrt ‚Äî Tim Kotzman (@TimKotzman) December 8, 2024 ‚ÄúAmazon should ‚Äì and perhaps has a fiduciary duty to ‚Äì consider adding assets to its treasury that appreciate more than bonds, even if those assets are more volatile shortterm,‚Äù the National Center for Public Policy Research wrote. Microsoft Rejects Bitcoin Investment Push The NCPPR‚Äôs proposal aligns with a broader push for institutional Bitcoin adoption. In October, it urged Microsoft to invest in Bitcoin through a similar letter. However, Microsoft advised shareholders to reject it , stating management already evaluates such matters. The proposal will be discussed this week at Microsoft‚Äôs annual meeting on Dec. 10. Amazon Invests in Blockchain, But Has So Far Avoided Crypto Meanwhile, Amazon has not confirmed plans to hold cryptocurrency on its balance sheet. However, it offers a managed blockchain service through Amazon Web Services and has posted job listings for digital currency and blockchain experts. Despite this, Amazon still does not accept cryptocurrency as payment on its shopping platform. MicroStrategy led the way in adopting Bitcoin as its primary treasury reserve asset among public companies. In Aug. 2020, it began buying Bitcoin to guard against inflation and economic risks. According to Bitcoin Treasuries , the company now holds 402.1k Bitcoin, worth over $40b. The post Amazon Faces Shareholder Call to Add Bitcoin to Balance Sheet appeared first on Cryptonews .

A moderate projection spans 2040‚Äì2045, while the pessimistic timeline places it beyond 2045.Interestingly, ChatGPT forecasts an optimistic timeline of 2045‚Äì2055 for DOGE to reach $30, requiring Dogecoin to dominate global finance. The chatbot presents a moderate timeline beyond 2055 but believes the $30 price target is unlikely in a pessimistic scenario.Nonetheless, Grok provides alternative views. For $10, sources suggest timelines ranging from 2025 to 2044. Predictions for $20 and $30 are sparse and often deemed improbable without extraordinary conditions. Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: WSPN Partners with Fractal to Expand Stablecoin Access on Bitcoin
Î≥∏Î¨∏: SINGAPORE , Dec. 9, 2024 /PRNewswire/ ‚Äî WSPN (Worldwide Stablecoin Payment Network), a global digital payments company, today announced a strategic partnership with Fractal, Bitcoin‚Äôs leading scaling solution, to expand the reach and utility of its stablecoin, WUSD. This collaboration will bring WSPN‚Äôs transparent, fully-backed stablecoin to Fractal‚Äôs high-performance Bitcoin ecosystem, marking a significant step in WUSD‚Äôs mission to bridge traditional finance with digital assets. The partnership will enable WUSD, which is backed 1:1 by US dollars and fully collateralized by high-quality liquid assets, to be seamlessly integrated into Fractal‚Äôs growing network of financial applications. This addresses a critical gap in the Bitcoin ecosystem by combining WSPN‚Äôs regulatory-compliant stablecoin infrastructure with Fractal‚Äôs ability to support internet-scale applications on Bitcoin. By leveraging Fractal‚Äôs unique scaling technology, which has already attracted over 2 million active users since its launch three months ago, WUSD will be able to process high volumes of transactions while maintaining the security guarantees of the Bitcoin network. ‚ÄúWSPN is committed to providing transparent, efficient digital payment solutions, and our partnership with Fractal represents a significant advancement in this mission,‚Äù said Raymond Yuan , WSPN Founder and CEO. ‚ÄúBy bringing WUSD to Fractal‚Äôs innovative Bitcoin scaling platform, we‚Äôre expanding our reach within the Bitcoin ecosystem while maintaining our core principles of stability, transparency, and compliance.‚Äù This collaboration comes as demand for regulated stablecoins continues to grow within the Bitcoin ecosystem. WUSD‚Äôs integration with Fractal will enable new use cases for stable, dollar-denominated transactions, including decentralized trading, lending, and payments. The partnership will leverage Fractal‚Äôs scaling capabilities to ensure WUSD transactions remain fast and cost-effective, even during periods of high demand. ‚ÄúIntegrating WUSD into Fractal marks a significant milestone in our mission to build a comprehensive financial ecosystem on Bitcoin,‚Äù said Spencer Yang , Core Contributor of Fractal. ‚ÄúBy partnering with WSPN, we‚Äôre bringing transparent, regulated stablecoin infrastructure to our platform, enabling users to access stable value alongside our native FB token and expanding the possibilities for DeFi applications on Bitcoin.‚Äù The integration is expected to complete in the coming months, with specific features and launch dates to be announced. For more information about WSPN and Fractal, visit www.wspn.io and fractalbitcoin.io . For media inquiries, please contact: marketing@wspn.io Spencer Yang from Fractal : s@fractalbitcoin.io About WSPN WSPN is a leading provider of next-generation stablecoin infrastructure, committed to building a more secure, efficient, and transparent payment solution for the global economy. Their flagship product, WUSD stablecoin, is pegged 1:1 to the U.S. Dollar and aims to optimize secure digital payments for Web3 users. WSPN‚Äôs Stablecoin 2.0 approach prioritizes user-centricity, community governance, and accessibility, paving the way for widespread stablecoin adoption. Learn more: www.wspn.io | X | LinkedIn About Factal Fractal Bitcoin is the only Bitcoin scaling solution that uses the Bitcoin Core code itself to recursively scale unlimited layers on top of the world‚Äôs most-secure and -held blockchain. Fractal enables infinite scalability and seamless integration with Bitcoin, allowing it to support internet-scale applications while maintaining high consistency with Bitcoin‚Äôs core principles. Fractal is seen as the ‚Äúinnovation playground‚Äù for Bitcoin, as it enables developers to flexibly try deployments with OP_CAT enabled, and provides a set of robust APIs and tooling to get started quickly. Fractal‚Äôs proof-of-work (PoW) mechanism ‚Äî Cadence Mining ‚Äî utilizes the same SHA256d algorithm as Bitcoin‚Äôs, with 1/3 merged-mined with Bitcoin and 2/3 permissionlessly-mined for a balance of security and decentralization. The network is strongly miner-supported, with approximately 50‚Äì60% of the Bitcoin hashrates merged-mining Fractal, making it one of the top PoW networks today. Website | X | Discord | Telegram

Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: El Salvador‚Äôs Bitcoin Gains Surpass $333 Million Amid Bitocin‚Äôs $100K Milestone
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele highlighted the country‚Äôs unrealized gains from its Bitcoin investments after the cryptocurrency surged past $100,000 for the first time on December 5. Following Bitcoin‚Äôs milestone, the crypto-focused X account Autism Capital asked Bukele to disclose El Salvador‚Äôs Bitcoin portfolio to ‚Äúdunk on the haters.‚Äù In response, Bukele posted the portfolio, revealing the nation‚Äôs nearly $270 million investment in Bitcoin. The portfolio confirms that no Bitcoin has been sold, and unrealized gains now exceed $333 million, a significant validation of the country‚Äôs strategy. El Salvador‚Äôs Bitcoin Journey El Salvador became the first country to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender on September 7, 2021, when its Bitcoin Law came into effect. A day prior, the government made its inaugural purchase of 200 BTC. Since then, the country has continued accumulating Bitcoin. On November 17, 2022, Bukele announced a dollar-cost averaging (DCA) strategy, committing to purchasing one Bitcoin daily. According to Nayib Tracker, a platform monitoring El Salvador‚Äôs Bitcoin holdings, the country currently owns 6,180 BTC, with an average purchase price of $44,739.88. Based on current prices, the portfolio has gained approximately 122%. Beyond financial gains, El Salvador has also seen increased tourism and international recognition since adopting Bitcoin. IMF Urges El Salvador to Reconsider Despite the reported benefits, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has repeatedly advised El Salvador to scale back its Bitcoin initiatives. On January 25, 2022, the IMF urged the country to stop recognizing Bitcoin as legal tender, citing financial stability risks but acknowledging its potential for financial inclusion. The IMF renewed its concerns on October 3, 2024, with communications director Julie Kozack recommending the country narrow the Bitcoin Law‚Äôs scope and limit public sector exposure to Bitcoin.

Îâ¥Ïä§Ï†úÎ™©: Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse makes highly-anticipated appearance on 60 Minutes
Î≥∏Î¨∏: Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse appeared on CBS‚Äô 60 Minutes , delivering a sharp, unapologetic defense of Ripple‚Äôs strategies, XRP‚Äôs meteoric rise, and the crypto industry‚Äôs growing political muscle. Ripple, alongside two other crypto firms, funneled $144 million into super PACs supporting pro-crypto candidates across party lines. These efforts weren‚Äôt subtle, and the results were loud. Of the 62 congressional candidates backed by the industry (29 Republicans and 33 Democrats) 85% walked away with victories. ‚ÄúDo I think we had an impact? Absolutely,‚Äù he said. Crypto cash and political clout Ripple‚Äôs role in the 2024 election cycle was a calculated move, with one-third of all corporate donations to super PACs coming from the crypto industry. The stakes were high, and Brad, along with other industry elites, knew that they needed to seize control of the Congress. Margaret Brennan, the interviewer, pressed him on whether Ripple‚Äôs financial contributions amounted to ‚Äúbuying elections.‚Äù Brad dismissed the notion, arguing that voters ultimately made their choices, but he didn‚Äôt deny Ripple‚Äôs heavy hand in funding candidates‚Äô campaigns. ‚ÄúWe educated voters, as many industries do, about candidates,‚Äù he said, while also acknowledging, ‚ÄúWe absolutely supercharged candidates with money.‚Äù President Donald Trump‚Äôs Cabinet picks signaled a confirmation of his expected crypto-friendly approach. Treasury Secretary nominee Scott Bessent has said that ‚ÄúCrypto is about freedom and the crypto economy is here to stay.‚Äù The president also tapped Paul Atkins, a former SEC commissioner with ties to crypto companies, to replace outgoing Chair Gary Gensler at the Securities and Exchange Commission. He has also appointed the first-ever White House Crypto czar. The SEC‚Äôs hostile crackdown and Ripple‚Äôs fightback Ripple‚Äôs battles with the SEC are nothing new. The agency filed a lawsuit against Ripple in December 2020, alleging that XRP was an unregistered security. Brad called the lawsuit a symptom of a broader ‚Äúwar on crypto,‚Äù a conflict he says was fueled by Gensler‚Äôs leadership. ‚ÄúWhy did these companies come together and organize Fairshake? It‚Äôs a reaction to a war on crypto,‚Äù Brad said, referring to the super PAC Ripple helped create. It is now the largest crypto super PAC. Brad emphasized that Ripple has spent over $150 million fighting the SEC in court, arguing that XRP doesn‚Äôt fit the traditional definition of a security. ‚ÄúI think I‚Äôm reasonably intelligent about something like, ‚ÄòWhat is a security?‚Äô Never once had I considered the possibility that XRP is a security,‚Äù he said. Not everyone agrees with Ripple‚Äôs position. John Reed Stark, a former SEC official, argued that courts have consistently ruled in favor of the SEC, describing the designation of XRP as a security as ‚Äúan obvious call.‚Äù Stark, who owns no crypto and has never worked for the industry, doubled down on his critique, calling crypto ‚Äúa scourge‚Äù and pointing out its use in crimes like ransomware, sanctions evasion, and money laundering. ‚ÄúNorth Korea is financing their nuclear weapons program using crypto,‚Äù he has said. Brad dismissed such broad-brush accusations, pointing out that bad actors exist in every industry. ‚ÄúBernie Madoff went to jail. That doesn‚Äôt make every hedge fund manager a criminal,‚Äù he countered, adding that Ripple is one of the ‚Äúgood actors,‚Äù working with financial institutions to improve cross-border payments using XRP. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been asking to be regulated. Just give us clear rules of the road,‚Äù Brad said. Another thing Trump also wants to do is move the regulatory authority of crypto entirely from the SEC to the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), an agency with a reputation for being more industry-friendly. But Stark said that the lighter regulatory touch will not adequately protect investors. ‚ÄúThe SEC‚Äôs mandate is investor protection. The CFTC is about market integrity. It‚Äôs a much easier regulatory regime for the crypto industry,‚Äù he said. XRP‚Äôs resurgence and Ripple‚Äôs next moves Since Election Day, XRP‚Äôs value has surged over 300%, reinforcing its position as a market leader. Ripple hasn‚Äôt wasted time capitalizing on this momentum. Brad recently announced an additional $25 million contribution to Fairshake, bringing its total funds to $103 million. The super PAC is already preparing for the next election cycle, ensuring that pro-crypto candidates remain well-funded. Despite the growing acceptance of crypto, skeptics like JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon and legendary investor Warren Buffet continue to dismiss it as a ‚Äúpet rock‚Äù and ‚Äúrat poison squared.‚Äù Brad brushed off such criticism, pointing to the success of the Bitcoin ETF, which launched earlier this year and attracted record-breaking investments. ‚ÄúIt attracted more assets in less time than any ETF ever before.‚Äù At press time, XRP was worth $2.50, down by 3.5% in the past twenty-four hours.

Î≥∏Î¨∏: The post Ripple CEO on 60 Minutes: Garlinghouse Opens Up on $150 Million SEC Fight, Crypto War And More appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse appeared in an interview on 60 Minutes , a iring on December 8, 2024, where he discussed the company‚Äôs ongoing legal fight with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Garlinghouse criticized the SEC‚Äôs approach, stating that it was a key reason why Ripple and two other companies formed the industry super PAC, FairShake, to fight back against what he described as a ‚Äúwar on crypto.‚Äù He suggested that FairShake might not have existed if the SEC had a different chairman than Gary Gensler. When an SEC spokesperson said that the amount spent by the crypto industry on legal defense is minimal compared to the losses investors have faced due to frauds and market failures, Garlinghouse revealed Ripple‚Äôs financial contributions, revealing that the company has spent over $150 million fighting the SEC‚Äôs stance on XRP. He said that Ripple argues XRP should not be treated like a stock and be subject to the same registration and disclosure requirements. Garlinghouse stressed that Ripple is not seeking to be deregulated but instead asking for clear regulations from Congress to address the unique nature of digital assets. ‚ÄúI went to Harvard Business School. I think I‚Äôm reasonably intelligent about something like, ‚ÄúWhat is a security?‚Äù So never once had I considered the possibility‚Äì that, ‚ÄúOkay, maybe XRP‚Äôs a security. We haven‚Äôt been asking to be deregulated. We‚Äôve been asking to be regulated. So we have been saying, ‚ÄúHey, look, just give us clear rules of the road,‚Äù he said.
